intro: Tetraria nigrovaginata, commonly known as the black-vaginal tetraria, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant features a thalloid structure with a dark green to blackish upper surface and a lighter, often reddish underside. Its reproductive structures, including sorocarps, are borne on stalks and contain spores. Tetraria nigrovaginata is characterized by its unique morphology and is often found in temperate regions with high humidity.
